### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://com.plexapp.android](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcom.plexapp.android) ### Comment > At first, I thought this was a DNS issue, but I disabled DNS and tried again but had the same issue. > > I tried to turn off Adguard completely and to my surprise, the Plex Android app worked instantly. > > I have tried keeping Adguard enabled and disabling all filters but unfortunately, the Plex app does not work. I have to completely disable Adguard to get it to work. > > Or If I disable Route traffic through Adguard for Plex it also works. > > So it's something in Adguard core that is blocking the Plex app from loading. issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

 4.3.53

issue.title: Canada.ca -- many webpages have "Date modified" CMS tag stripped out by AdGuard - Social Widgets filter in uBO
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard Annoyances filter for uBlock Origin - updated today

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many. Examples - https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html;  https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html 

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Many webpages on the Government of Canada's website (canada.ca) have a "Date modified" CMS tag near the bottom, just above the black footer section. (This is important for multiple reasons, including that people may need to know when the page has been modified so they can look for the changed content on the page.)

For a large number of those webpages, the "Date modified" line is stripped out by three popular filter lists for uBlock Origin:

* AdGuard - Social Widgets

* EasyList - Social Widgets

* Fanboy's Annoyance List

(I confirmed each had that effect with careful one-by-one process of elimination.)

This is on Chrome and Edge for Windows, fully updated with updated extensions and filters.

Here are examples of two high-level webpages on which this occurs:

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html

(I have already reported this on the Lanik forums to request action on the same problem in the EasyList and Fanboy filters.)

Thank you for your help.

3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

Date modified visible:
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/173762823/2e13ded2-a141-4a11-a8c2-54a265447f22)
</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>
Date modified removed:
<!-- paste screenshot here -->

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/173762823/0b28c225-c471-4dc6-823b-d303dc111ff3)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/182198) if other issue.

comment.body: @panzer-ui Please install microShield userscript.

issue.title: canada.ca
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard ~~Annoyances~~  _Social Widgets_ filter for uBlock Origin - updated today

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many. Examples - https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html;  https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html 

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Many webpages on the Government of Canada's website (canada.ca) have a "Date modified" CMS tag near the bottom, just above the black footer section. (This is important for multiple reasons, including that people may need to know when the page has been modified so they can look for the changed content on the page.)

For a large number of those webpages, the "Date modified" line is stripped out by three popular filter lists for uBlock Origin:

* AdGuard - Social Widgets

* EasyList - Social Widgets

* Fanboy's Annoyance List

(I confirmed each had that effect with careful one-by-one process of elimination.)

This is on Chrome and Edge for Windows, fully updated with updated extensions and filters.

Here are examples of two high-level webpages on which this occurs:

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html

(I have already reported this on the Lanik forums to request action on the same problem in the EasyList and Fanboy filters.)

Thank you for your help.

3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

Date modified visible:
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/173762823/2e13ded2-a141-4a11-a8c2-54a265447f22)
</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>
Date modified removed:
<!-- paste screenshot here -->

issue.title: canada.ca

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard ~~Annoyances~~  _Social Widgets_ filter for uBlock Origin - updated today

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many. Examples - https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html;  https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html 

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Many webpages on the Government of Canada's website (canada.ca) have a "Date modified" CMS tag near the bottom, just above the black footer section. (This is important for multiple reasons, including that people may need to know when the page has been modified so they can look for the changed content on the page.)

For a large number of those webpages, the "Date modified" line is stripped out by three popular filter lists for uBlock Origin:

* AdGuard - Social Widgets

* EasyList - Social Widgets

* Fanboy's Annoyance List

(I confirmed each had that effect with careful one-by-one process of elimination.)

This is on Chrome and Edge for Windows, fully updated with updated extensions and filters.

Here are examples of two high-level webpages on which this occurs:

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/culture.html

https://www.canada.ca/en/services/jobs.html

(I have already reported this on the Lanik forums to request action on the same problem in the EasyList and Fanboy filters.)

Thank you for your help.

3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

Date modified visible:
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/173762823/2e13ded2-a141-4a11-a8c2-54a265447f22)
</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>
Date modified removed:
<!-- paste screenshot here -->

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/173762823/0b28c225-c471-4dc6-823b-d303dc111ff3)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Fixed.
Still can be broken if webmaster rewrite CSS to use more `overflow: clip;` at page.

issue.title: youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment Username: @Tiagoquix > Tracking parameters when sharing YouTube videos. > > From a desktop web browser: browsing YouTube videos ( for example: `https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=mrbeast` ) and copying a video link from the search page results in an URL with a "&pp=" parameter to it; probably to track which user shared the video. > > From the mobile app: sharing a Shorts video results in a URL with a "&si=" parameter to it; probably to track which user shared the video. > > Examples: `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_z-W4UVHkw&pp=ygUHbXJiZWFzdA%3D%3D` | `https://youtube.com/shorts/SXPOmuGspYE?si=6cy15X_OzXII-tIs` > > Suggested filters: > ``` > ||youtube.com^$removeparam=pp > ||youtube.com^$removeparam=si > ``` ### Screenshots

Third-party filter causes the issue. Reported to maintainers. https://github.com/MajkiIT/polish-ads-filter/issues/22454

Please add this rule to the user rules or disable Official Polish filters for AdBlock, uBlock Origin & AdGuard filter 
`nehnutelnosti.sk#@#[id^="adv-"]:not(#adv-settings):not(.adv-player-container)`

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,7 @@
 ! Good: example.org###rek; ||example.com/ads/
 ! Bad: example.org#@##banner_ad (for instance, should be in allowlist.txt or in antiadblock.txt)
 !
+||azurewebsites.net^$domain=npo.nl
comment.body:
I guess it's about ad like reported here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166205
If so, it's already fixed by a scriptlet and I cannot reproduce it, though it might be useful for platforms which do not support scriptlets.
I guess that `azurewebsites.net` might be used for other purposes than ad as well, so could this rule be more "ad related"?
For example:
```adblock
||azurewebsites.net/*adslot$domain=npo.nl
```

This can possibly work for other npo.nl related sites but are not tested.

comment.body:
The scriptlet did not work for me on Firefox with uBlock Origin (all latest version).

`azurewebsites.net` is only used for tracking and serving ads from the network connections I saw, I noticed no breakage on the site itself

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment Username: @Tiagoquix > Tracking parameters when sharing YouTube videos. > > From a desktop web browser: browsing YouTube videos ( for example: `https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=mrbeast` ) and copying a video link from the search page results in an URL with a "&pp=" parameter to it; probably to track which user shared the video. > > From the mobile app: sharing a Shorts video results in a URL with a "&si=" parameter to it; probably to track which user shared the video. > > Examples: `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_z-W4UVHkw&pp=ygUHbXJiZWFzdA%3D%3D` | `https://youtube.com/shorts/SXPOmuGspYE?si=6cy15X_OzXII-tIs` > > Suggested filters: > ``` > ||youtube.com^$removeparam=pp > ||youtube.com^$removeparam=si > ``` ### Screenshots
